title: Seven Buddhist monks reported dead in cable car accident at Na Uyana Monastery
byline: (UPDATED) The death toll from the cable car accident at the Na Uyana Monastery (Nā Uyana Āranya Senāsanaya) at Pansiyagama in Melsiripura has increased to seven Buddhist monks.

title: President Dissanayake addresses UN General Assembly
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is currently addressing the General Debate of the 80th Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA) at the United Nations in New York.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu rejects western recognitions of Palestinian State
byline: The recent recognitions by some Western nations of a Palestinian state will not “bind Israel in any way,” Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday.

title: President Anura Kumara urges world leaders to commit themselves to building a safe world for future generations
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake addressed poverty, corruption, education, sustainability, ethnic and religious diversity of country, condemnation of war, digital democracy, strict laws against drug trafficking and crimes during his speech at the 80th session of UN General Assembly in New York.

title: Cable car accident at Na Uyana Monastery: Several injured monks continue to receive treatment
byline: Several Buddhist monks injured in the cable car accident at the Na Uyana Monastery (Nā Uyana Āranya Senāsanaya) at Pansiyagama in Melsiripura continue to receive treatment at the Kurunegala and Polgahawela hospitals.

title: UN chief stresses need to ensure human control of AI over use of force
byline: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday stressed the importance of ensuring human control of artificial intelligence (AI) over the use of force.

title: President Anura Kumara, Pakistan PM agree to boost bilateral ties at UNGA
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif met on the sidelines of the 80th United Nations General Assembly, reaffirming the longstanding goodwill between Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts. Heavy falls of about 100 mm are likely at some places.

title: Speaker reaffirms his decision to reject NCM filed against Deputy Minister of Defence
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (25) announced to Parliament that he is not in a position to accept the No-Confidence Motion submitted against Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General (Retd.) Aruna Jayasekara by a group of Parliamentarians, citing Parliament procedures.

title: President meets Australian and Portuguese leaders in New York
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake held bilateral discussions with Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese at the Permanent Mission of Sri Lanka to the United Nations in New York on the side-lines of the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Minister Vijitha Herath holds talks with Maldives, Finland and Germany FMs
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has held bilateral talks with Ministers of several countries on the sideline of the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly.

title: Iran, US signal possible easing in nuclear tensions
byline: Tehran and Washington signalled a possible softening in nuclear tensions on Wednesday (24), with Iran insisting it has no ambitions to build nuclear weapons and the US expressing readiness to resume talks aimed at resolving the long-standing standoff.

title: Hong Kong reopens after world’s most powerful cyclone Ragasa
byline: Hong Kong resumed flights out of its international airport on Thursday after a 36-hour suspension, reopening businesses, transportation services and some schools after the world’s most powerful tropical cyclone this year lashed the financial hub.

title: Three dead and four injured in head-on collision between lorry and van in Thalawa
byline: Three individuals have died and four others have been injured in a head-on collision between a lorry and a van in the Thalawa–Mirigama junction along the Kurunegala–Anuradhapura main road, police stated.

title: Death toll in Thalawa van-lorry crash climbs to four
byline: The death toll in the accident that occurred along the Kurunegala–Anuradhapura main road has risen to four, according to police.

title: President urges world leaders to commit themselves to building a safe world
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake addressed poverty, corruption, education, sustainability, ethnic and religious diversity of country, condemnation of war, digital democracy, strict laws against drug trafficking and crimes during his speech at the 80th session of UN General Assembly in New York.

title: Sri Lanka, UN discuss engagement of troops in peacekeeping operations
byline: A high-level United Nations delegation met the Secretary to the Ministry of Defence yesterday (24) to discuss enhancing collaboration in international peacekeeping missions and strengthening human rights initiatives.

title: Speaker reaffirms his rejection of NCM against Deputy Defence Minister
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (25) announced to Parliament that he is not in a position to accept the No-Confidence Motion submitted against Deputy Minister of Defence, Major General (Retd.) Aruna Jayasekara by a group of Parliamentarians, citing Parliament procedures.

title: Wife of ‘Backhoe Saman’ further remanded
byline: The wife of underworld figure ‘Backhoe Saman’, Shadhika Lakshani, who is currently in remand custody under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, has been further remanded.

title: Indian authorities impose security restrictions in remote Ladakh after deadly clashes
byline: Authorities in India enforced security restrictions in two main districts in the remote Ladakh region on Thursday (Sep 25), a day after four people were killed and dozens injured when police clashed with hundreds of protesters demanding greater autonomy from the Indian government for the Himalayan territory.

title: Over 1,000 individuals arrested during special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 1,006 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (24).

title: Only 50% of data provided by public during wildlife census accurate: Dy Minister
byline: Around 50% of the information provided by the general public during the recent wildlife census was found to be accurate, according to Deputy Minister of Agriculture and Livestock Namal Karunaratne.

title: Court grants permission to detain and question suspects in Tangalle drugs seizure
byline: The Tangalle Magistrate’s Court has granted permission to police to detain and question three suspects arrested in connection with the discovery of crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’) and heroin in three lorries in Seenimodara, Tangalle.

title: Australia’s social media ban for teens draws praise at UN
byline: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese promoted his government’s world-first teen social media ban at an event in New York, warning the challenges posed by social media for children was “constantly evolving”.

title: Drone activity confirmed at multiple Denmark airports
byline: Denmark’s Aalborg airport in the country’s north has been closed after unauthorised drones were seen in its airspace, according to local authorities.

title: Meta CEO Zuckerberg says Instagram has grown to 3 billion monthly active users
byline: Meta Platforms’ Instagram has grown to 3 billion Monthly Active Users, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday, marking another milestone for one of the most popular social media apps in the world.

title: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy found guilty of criminal conspiracy in Libya case
byline: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy has been found guilty of criminal conspiracy in a case related to taking millions of euros of illicit funds from the late Libyan leader Col Muammar Gaddafi.

title: Ex-Minister Manusha Nanayakkara summoned to Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara has been summoned to the Bribery Commission.

title: Ex-President Ranil extends condolences over tragic accident at Na Uyana Monastery
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has expressed his condolences over the passing of several local and foreign Buddhist monks in the tragic accident at the Na Uyana Monastery (Nā Uyana Āranya Senāsanaya) at Pansiyagama in Melsiripura.

title: Sri Lankan woman among 2 arrested after ‘typhoon selfie’ incident endangers child in HK
byline: Hong Kong police have arrested two women, identified as nationals of India and Sri Lanka, following a perilous incident during Typhoon Ragasa in which a young child was endangered.

title: Philippines cancels classes, flights as new storm looms
byline: The Philippines shut schools and scrapped flights on Thursday (Sep 25) as a fresh storm threatened to hit just days after a super typhoon killed nine people in the archipelago.

title: Tourist arrivals in September top 110,000
byline: A total of 111,823 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in September, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.
